page.title: 10FLAX BOURTON VILLAGE
page.content: Flax Bourton is a small rural village close to the city of Bristol.Only a handful of its inhabitants work within the village itself the remainder use the busy A 370 road to reach their place of employment mainly in Bristol. Its surroundings of fertile farmland and unspoilt countryside make it a popular place to live.Many of its older buildings have recently been modernised yet have still kept their external features.The church although small has a beautiful norman arch and font.The church at Barrow Gurney although not as old has some fine examples of Kemp stained glass windows. Farleigh Hospital which was originally built as a poor house is a good example of Victorian building.
